organizers.text: We believe KDD is the perfect venue for this discussion, and the fruit of the workshop can also benefit the core missions of the conference – to facilitate more effective data mining and knowledge discovery.
This workshop aims to explore and advance the current state of research and practice in answering these challenges.

His other research focuses on the creation of financial knowledge graphs from unstructured data sources such as regulatory filings and analyst reports, which includes interpretation of tabular data from these documents.

He had participated in many government organized projects/competitions such as TREC, RADAR, ACE, GALE and TACKBP, published in conferences such as ICME, ICoS, NAACL, IJCAI, AAAI and SIGIR, and organized the Knowledge Graph tutorial in KDD 2018.

His research interests include language detection, key phrase extraction, sentiment analysis, named entity recognition, entity linking, coreference resolution, relation extraction, knowledge base construction, summarization, and question answering.
During his time at Microsoft he has been a Principal Scientist in Satori (knowledge graph) and Bot Framework (conversational AI).

Generic Highlights.text: Researchers, practitioners, and students of any relevant discipline needed for document understanding, including but not limited to data mining, knowledge discovery, machine learning, information retrieval, natural language processing, layout recognition, computer vision, and other technologies are welcome.

While many research areas relevant to DI are separately covered in other conferences such as ICML, NeurIPS, SIGIR, ACL, ICDAR, CVPR and AAAI, the interdisciplinary nature of the pursuit calls for a venue where all interested parties can freely exchange novel ideas, discuss open problems, and compare competing approaches.
Prior to Google Research, Sandeep was a Research Staff Member at IBM’s Almaden Research Center.
Benjamin Han is the Principal Science Manager leading the research and development of the natural language services on Microsoft Azure Cognitive Services.
He has a PhD from the University of Michigan.

Question 1.question: Who are the organizers
Question 1.statement: The name of the organizers are not explicitly mentioned in the given sources. However, source 2 mentions that the "Document Intelligence Workshop 2019" was organized along with NeurIPS 2019 in Vancouver, Canada and was a huge success. Source 4 mentions a full-day workshop proposal, but it does not mention the organizers. Source 7 mentions that they plan to invite two program managers from funding agencies. Without further information, it is not possible to determine who the organizers are.
